Constructor Detail

Toolbar

public Toolbar()
Constructor for the Toolbar. Creates the tool buttons, arranges within the panel in proper layout, attachs necessary listeners, etc. Records references to the needed buttons so we can later set/get the tool and color choices.

Method Detail

getCurrentTool

public int getCurrentTool()
Returns current tool selected, using the public enumerated Toolbar constants SELECT, RECT, OVAL, etc. to identify the different tools. If there is currently no selected button, (shouldn't happen), -1 is returned.

setCurrentTool

public void setCurrentTool(int toolNum)
Changes current tool, by selecting a new button and deselecting previous selection. toolNum parameter should be one of the public enumerated Toolbar constants SELECT, RECT, OVAL, etc. If invalid, an array out of bounds exception will be thrown.

getCurrentColor

public java.awt.Color getCurrentColor()
Returns current color showing on the toolbar's color button.

setCurrentColor

public void setCurrentColor(java.awt.Color color)
Sets current color showing on the toolbar's color button. Anytime the current color is changed, a ChangeEvent is sent to all registered listeners.

addChangeListener

public void addChangeListener(javax.swing.event.ChangeListener l)
Adds a ChangeListener to the toolbar. Whenever the color is changed on the toolbar, the listener will be notified with a change event.

removeChangeListener

public void removeChangeListener(javax.swing.event.ChangeListener l)
Removes a ChangeListener from the toolbar.
